alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 9:27PM EDT until April 09 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Elliston....and at Edwardsport down to Petersburg. .Following areas of one to two inches of rainfall on Wednesday... lowland, minor flooding along the East Fork White River...continues at Seymour...while on the White River minor flooding has resumed at Elliston...and continues at Edwardsport and points downriver. The crest on the East Fork White River has passed Seymour...yet this slowly passing crest is expected to hold Lawrence County points in action stage to near bankfull into early next week. The White River is forecast to crest this weekend. Flooding is expected to continue on the East Fork White River at Seymour into Saturday...while aforementioned points on the White River should remain in minor flood into next week. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Dry conditions are expected through next week... which will allow the lowest portions of the White River to crest and fall below flood by next weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Elliston. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River approaching River Road north of CR 150 W in Greene County. Some low lying agricultural land begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Friday.
